commitMessage:
@@@Implement the read/write pending contract in the SSL channel (not doing so would likely still trigger the exception.  but would add corruption).

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1577757 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

@@@Fix infinite loop observed while running unit tests when write is called
with no data on the input side and wrapping also produces no data.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1661518 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

@@@Fix infinite loop observed while running unit tests when write is called
with no data on the input side and wrapping also produces no data.
This is the non-timeout version of the fix that was previously applied
to get(long. TimeUnit)

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1662706 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

@@@Investigating 57799 I found some issues in the SSL impl:
- Possibly incomplete writes.
- After some errors (which shouldn't happen however).  the pending flag could still be set.
- A bad idea to deal with possible behavior differences for read IO calls between NIO and NIO2 (according to my testing.  it doesn't seem to be needed). Test: the byte counter.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1672297 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

@@@- Remove read/write pending flags since they don't really add anything.  use a lot of finally and are still slightly incorrect without additional finally (or similar).
- Simplify.  harmonize and cleanups.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1673555 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
